Course Description: THIS COURSE GUIDES THE STUDENT IN DEALING WITH ETHICAL AND TAX ACCOUNTING ISSUES OF INDIVIDUALS AND BUSINESSES.  IN ADDITION, STUDENTS UTILIZE THEIR KNOWLEDGE OF THE TAX LAW, INTEGRATING AND APPLYING SKILLS AND TECHNIQUES ACQUIRED IN THEIR PREVIOUS COURSES TO PASS THE ACCREDITED TAX PREPARER (ATP) CERTIFICATION EXAM.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
1. CONFRONT AND RESOLVE ACCOUNTING PROBLEMS BY INTEGRATING AND APPLYING SKILLS AND TECHNIQUES ACQUIRED IN THEIR PREVIOUS COURSES.
2. AID STUDENTS IN DEVELOPING A PERSONAL CODE OF ETHICS BY EXPLORING ETHICAL DILEMMAS AND PRESSURES THEY WILL FACE AS ACCOUNTANTS.
3. EXHIBIT A THOROUGH KNOWLEDGE OF THE EXISTING TAX CODE AND THE PREPARATION OF INDIVIDUAL TAX RETURNS WITH AN EXPERTISE IN COMPREHENSIVE 1040 ISSUES INCLUDING SUPPORTING SCHEDULES, SELF-EMPLOYED RETURNS, AND ETHICS. 
4. PREPARE THE STUDENT FOR ACCREDITED TAX PREPARER (ATP) EXAM.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
